overview: When a lonely German official (Burghart Klaussner) stationed in Tbilisi, Georgia, befriends a spunky 12-year-old living in one of the city's refugee camps, their budding relationship invites accusations of pedophilia -- and inadvertently stokes the fires of violence. Dito Tsintsadze, a native Georgian, directs this thought-provoking Tribeca Film Festival selection exploring the outcome of misunderstood intentions.
title: The Man from the Embassy
